forgeLabs.appName: PolicyPulse â€” Healthcare AI Compliance Alert Feed
forgeLabs.problem: Hospital CIOs and compliance officers can't keep up with the avalanche of state AI bills affecting healthcare â€” 15+ states introduced new bills in the past week alone. No tool aggregates and distills these into actionable alerts by jurisdiction.
forgeLabs.solution: Real-time legislative intelligence feed that monitors state and federal AI bills impacting healthcare, scores relevance by jurisdiction, and delivers weekly digest emails + Slack/Teams notifications. Dashboard shows which bills affect YOUR state, with plain-English summaries and compliance action items.
forgeLabs.moat: Curated healthcare-specific legislative data (not generic AI law trackers). FORGE's domain expertise scores relevance. First-mover in healthcare-specific AI legislative monitoring as a self-service SaaS.
forgeLabs.dataSource: LegiScan API (free tier available), state legislature RSS feeds, Federal Register, CMS/HHS announcements. Transparency Coalition AI tracker as validation source.
forgeLabs.competitionCheck: Generic AI law trackers exist (TCAI map, BSA tracker) but none are healthcare-specific, none offer compliance action items, none deliver as SaaS with alerts. No app store competitors found.
forgeLabs.buildTime: 2-3 nights â€” scraper + scoring engine + email digest + simple dashboard
forgeLabs.deployTo: Web app (SaaS), Chrome extension for compliance officers, Slack/Teams integration
forgeLabs.monetization: Free: 1 state, weekly digest. Pro $49/mo: all states + federal, daily alerts, Teams/Slack integration, compliance action items. Enterprise $199/mo: API access, custom jurisdiction bundles, audit trail.
forgeLabs.confidence: High â€” the Feb 13 TCAI legislative update alone shows 15+ active healthcare AI bills. This pain is real and growing weekly. Aligns perfectly with LUMEN Scanner positioning.

articles.title: Survey: Nearly 50% of Hospitals Aren't Ready to Implement AI at Scale
articles.takeaway: 78% of health systems engaged in AI projects but only 52% operationally ready. Top barriers: cybersecurity (48%), limited budgets (48%), data governance (42%), lack of strategic vision (36%). This is EXACTLY FORGE's Activation Bridge value prop.
articles.linkedInAngle: Share the stat '78% doing AI, 48% not ready' and position FORGE as the bridge between pilot and production. This validates the entire consulting thesis.

articles.title: AI Legislative Update: Feb. 13, 2026 â€” 15+ State Bills Moving
articles.takeaway: New Hampshire HB 1406 prohibits AI from overriding provider judgment. Arizona, Hawaii, Ohio, Illinois, Tennessee, Virginia all advancing healthcare AI bills. The regulatory complexity is exploding â€” exactly what LUMEN Scanner was built for.
articles.linkedInAngle: Post about the regulatory tsunami hitting healthcare AI and how most hospitals have no systematic way to track which bills affect them. Positions FORGE as the governance expert.

articles.title: HHS RFI on Accelerating AI in Clinical Care â€” Comments Due Feb 23
articles.dateNote: RFI issued Dec 23, 2025; reminder article published ~Feb 10 per NLR. Comments due Feb 23, 2026 â€” still within action window.
articles.takeaway: HHS seeking input on regulatory approaches for AI in clinical care. Focus: risk-proportionate rules, patient protection, innovation. FORGE should consider submitting a comment to build credibility and visibility.
articles.linkedInAngle: Post about the HHS RFI deadline approaching and what it means for healthcare AI vendors. Position FORGE as engaged in shaping policy, not just reacting to it.

linkedInPulse.topic: Multi-agent, domain-specific and governed models will define healthcare genAI in 2026
linkedInPulse.insight: Industry shifting from monolithic LLMs to modular, governed architectures. Governance is now 'core infrastructure' not afterthought. Validates LUMEN's entire positioning as runtime governance middleware.
linkedInPulse.note: Not a LinkedIn post but a widely-shared CIO thought leadership piece â€” strong reshare material for Sean's LinkedIn.

events.name: AI for Hospitals & Health Plans Summit
events.relevance: Focused on clinical decision support, predictive analytics, ethics, regulation. Perfect audience for LUMEN SDK pitch.

video.title: Clinical AI Governance: What Clinicians Must Know in 2026
video.takeaway: Covers FDA clearance vs approval, implementation bottlenecks, model drift, and governance frameworks for clinical AI. Aligns with LUMEN's runtime governance positioning.
